greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows equal to the matrix product R^-1*Q, where Q = A135885 and R = A135894; R^-1*Q equals triangle R shifted down one row.
example: This triangle equals matrix product R^-1*Q,
which equals triangle R shifted down one row,
where column k of R equals column 0 of P^(2k+1),
and column k of Q=P^2 equals column 0 of P^(2k+2), for k>=0.
program: (PARI) {T(n,k)=local(P=Mat(1),R=Mat(1),PShR);if(n>0,for(i=0,n, PShR=matrix(#P,#P, r,c, if(r>=c,if(r==c,1,if(c==1,0,P[r-1,c-1]))));R=P*PShR; R=matrix(#P+1, #P+1, r,c, if(r>=c, if(r<#P+1,R[r,c], if(c==1,(P^2)[ #P,1],(P^(2*c-1))[r-c+1,1])))); P=matrix(#R, #R, r,c, if(r>=c, if(r<#R,P[r,c], (R^c)[r-c+1,1])))));(R^-1*P^2)[n+1,k+1]}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 15 2007
